intro: Bouchea boyacana var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth bouchea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a fine, smooth texture, distinguishing it from other varieties. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
